column4: Hello. On Ubuntu 9.10 there seems to be a problem with rdesktop and some [Shift]+[key] combinations. I'm not able to use "/", "=", ">", ";" ... Any idea how to solve this?
this is due to the different language settings on your windows box... set it to english on both and try then
I can't set the language stting to English on the server.
so server has no graphical user interface? just the command line?
The server has a gui. What could I try to do?
is that a windows machine you are connecting to?
if so, just use the language settings...
Yes, I tried several machines (XP, w2008)
What does that mean "use the langhuage settings"?
what layout are you using on your machine? the keyboard layout... english? estonian...?
ok, try setting the keyboard in the windows also to german... it is in the language settings in the control panel
The windows machines are set correctly. It works from every other rdesktop client (6.06, 8.04, Debian ...)
I can't touch the windows settings.
then this is really weird.. i also had this problem, but i was able to use my "estonian" keyboard, by setting the windows layout to english (default)
sorry, don't know how to help you
